jobs.title: Web Product Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Role Objective:
We are looking for a passionate Product Manager to be part of our Blasting News’Product Team. The key objective of this person will be to define and implement our new desktop and mobile web features. The future potential, of this role, is the opportunity to grow and lead a specific area of the Product Management Team as we expand the business.

Responsibilities:

  • Develop and implement web and mobile functionalities - identifying the best product choices and writing detailed functional product specifications;
  • Work closely with the graphic designer during the design phase;
  • Work closely with software engineering teams during the development cycles;
  • Monitor the live release of new applications and constantly test the new functionalities;
  • Manage analytics tools, constantly monitoring sets of KPIs and taking decisions based on data;
  • Sharing knowledge of international best practices;
  • Collaborate effectively and extensively across the business in order to achieve desired results.

Skills and Experience:

  • 3+ years of hands-on experience in drafting product specification documents according to the most common industry standards;
  • Experience in managing analytics tools such as Google Analytics to constantly monitor sets of KPIs, including, but not limited to, the performance of web pages;
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving competencies;
  • Strong organisation, prioritisation and time management capabilities;
  • Ability to work autonomously and self-driven;
  • Fluent in Italian and English.

Attitude:
Attitude and approach are more important than competences at Blasting News and are the key to success. The candidate should:

  • Be entrepreneurial, proactive, and innovative;
  • Get things done, no matter what;
  • The easier, the better;
  • Never complain: focus on solutions, don’t focus on problems;
  • Lead by example, driving everybody else in the company toward better results;
  • Love positive pressure and new daily challenges;
  • Go beyond the daily assigned tasks;
  • Learn fast;
  • Listen first and be humble;
  • Be strict and fair with colleagues, partner, and clients. “It’s not easy to work here. You can work long, hard, or smart, but you can’t choose two out of three. But, we are working to build something important, something that we can all tell our grandchildren about. Such things aren’t meant to be easy”.

If you feel that you have what it takes to join our team and be successful in this role, please send us your CV, with a covering letter, letting us know why you are ‘the one’.
